documentation.title: Removed Proprietary CSV Escaping
documentation.standard: As of PHP 7.4, fputcsv() and fgetcsv() accept an empty string for the `$escape` parameter. This effectively disables the proprietary PHP escaping mechanism for CSV.

code.title: Cross-version compatible: not passing the $escape parameter or passing a non-empty string.
PHP >= 7.4: passing an empty string to disable the proprietary escaping mechanism.

documentation.standard: For str_getcsv(), the behaviour when passing an empty string has changed accordingly in PHP 7.4. Previously, an empty string would fall through to the default parameter value. Now it will disable the proprietary PHP escaping mechanism.

code.title: Cross-version compatible: not passing the $escape parameter or passing a non-empty string.
Not cross-version compatible: passing an empty string will fall through to the default value in PHP <= 7.3 and will disable the proprietary escaping mechanism in PHP >= 7.4.
